scenario_text.value: Wait, Aoi! Come on, wait up...!
Please, just leave me alone.
But...!
I don’t want to talk right now.

Don’t you see he came because he’s worried
about you, Aoi?
Not just him, everyone’s super worried!
I’m not worth all your concern!
Aoi...?
Saki is dead because of me.
What’re you saying, Aoi?!

Yeah, that’s not true...
There’s just...no way it’s your fault!
No, it’s okay...

I knew just how dangerous this world could
be...all too well.

And I’m the one...who let her go off on her
own. That’s how things turned out this way.

But you chased right after her
along with everyone, didn’t you?

We did everything in our power back then...
I’m sure of it.
Are you so sure...?
I knew Saki was anxious about her illness...

On the other hand, I saw how free and happy
she could be in this world.

She thought she could do something here...
She wanted to do everything she could.

I saw how eager she was. I could tell she
might go too far someday.
I knew that much, and yet I...!
Then I’m to blame, too!

You’re not the only one who couldn’t stop her
back there. I’m the same!
You’re wrong! Because I... I...
Somehow, I didn’t WANT to stop her...

I mean.. Saki was so incredibly gentle. She
shined so brightly...
Um, Aoi...?

Even yesterday, I should’ve wondered why she
was going off on her own...

A part of me was envious of her, somehow...
The truth is, I...
I admired that part of Saki!

I wanted to be like her. I wanted her to
acknowledge me.

And the part of me that wanted that put her
in danger!

What the heck are you saying, Aoi?! You
haven’t done a dang thing wrong!
No! No, it’s all my fault!

If only I’d noticed the Kenzoku disguised as
that child! If I hadn’t acted that way...

Then Saki wouldn’t have had to die. I just
know it!!!

(Oh, Aoi... I can’t believe you’d think this
way...)

(Still, her trying to take all of the blame
upon herself doesn’t make any sense.)

(I mean, Saki acted according to her own
will.)

(If I had to say... It might be all of our
faults. All of us...Saki included.)

(But...it’s not like playing the blame game
will bring her back.)

(I doubt she’d want us to be doing that in
the first place.)
(What should I say to Aoi?)
It’s not your fault.
Saki won’t come back.
We’re all to blame.
This isn’t your fault or anything, Aoi.

Then whose fault was it, exactly?! Tell me
who’s to blame!

If only I’d stopped her... If only I hadn’t
been so rash...
Then I... I... I...

If you have to blame somebody... Blame the
Master! It’s all his fault!

He’s the reason for all of this... The reason
we’re here.
So I want you to stop blaming yourself.

I understand how you feel, Aoi. But
tormenting yourself won’t bring Saki back.

...So what?! I’m supposed to just forget
about her?!
I didn’t say that! It’s just...

If we sit around mourning her instead of
doing anything, I think that’d make Saki sad.

So we just forge ahead, as if nothing
happened? I can’t do that!

As you say, Takuma, Saki won’t come
back to us...

If anyone’s to blame, then I’d say...it’s all
of our responsibilities. Saki included.

How could you say something so cruel,
Takuma?!

Am I wrong?! Saki acted according to her own
will!

She wanted to save everyone no matter what.
That feeling couldn’t be stopped by anyone!
But...but that’s...

It’s not anyone’s fault in particular... This
happened as a result of all of our choices!

If you only blame yourself, isn’t that the
same as denying Saki’s feelings?
I didn’t mean to...

Still... I don’t think I’m absolved of any
responsibility. Not a chance.
After all, yesterday I... I...
Aoi... Why are you doing this to yourself?

I’ll listen to all of your worries, all of
your fears, so... Talk to me? Please?
I’ll listen, too!
I’m sorry. I...don’t want to talk right now.
Aoi!

Could you just leave me alone for a little
while? Please...?
Aoi...

(I couldn’t comfort her or cheer her up.
She’s still in shock...)
(What can I do...?)
...Hey, Takuma.
Kaito...!
Couldn’t help but worry, y’know?

Looks like I stuck you with all the hard work.
Figured we should come and say something...

But even though I thought it over a bunch,
I got no clue what I should say to her...
Maybe we should follow her?

Naw, let her go. She asked for some time, and
I think we should give it to her.

Let her work through things on her own for
a while.
Yeah...
(I hope she manages to cheer up soon.)
